name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Apple has temporarily closed all 53 of its stores across California in response to the state’s coronavirus surge.

name: sfchronicle
text: The latest numbers put San Francisco on track to losing nearly two people a day by the end of the year and dwarf the 173 deaths from COVID-19 the city has seen so far this year. https://t.co/7trIEnOukW

name: sfchronicle
text:
“Clearly, he is our long-term starting center,” Warriors head coach Steve Kerr said Saturday. “When we feel that he’s ready for that, then we’ll put him out there.”

https://t.co/ikJ2JHbXJ5

name: sfchronicle
text: With long lines at stores and alarm over the coronavirus spreading, online grocery shopping has gotten supercharged. https://t.co/Sb9T4HgZzs

name: sfchronicle
text: ICYMI: It appears that no one at the California Employment Development Department noticed when a scammer filed for unemployment benefits under the name of Dianne Feinstein, California’s senior senator. https://t.co/4hb5mRanre

name: sfchronicle
text:
Is Mike McGlinchey's weight loss tied to his uneven pass protection? After head coach Kyle Shanahan didn’t dismiss that idea, general manager John Lynch was more direct.

https://t.co/cXop2TtO7z

name: sfchronicle
text:
“I’m very happy,” said Liz Mitchell, who hopped on the J-Church in S.F.'s Noe Valley. “It’s something special to have these trains go by again.”

https://t.co/GQkEgSvXIq

name: sfchronicle
text: Escape to San Francisco! Here are eight fun and fascinating spots to explore to cure the locked-down holiday blues >> https://t.co/ONnJbVeCsy

name: sfchronicle
text:
Petaluma police said they were looking into a widely publicized incident at a craft store to learn whether a local couple were falsely accused by an internet influencer of kidnapping her two children.

https://t.co/Wi0eIUnVKr

name: sfchronicle
text:
Berkeley officials said on Saturday that front-line health care workers at Alta Bates Summit Medical Center “received the first COVID-19 vaccinations in Berkeley.” On Twitter, masked employees gave thumbs up and posed for photos while receiving the shots.

https://t.co/MeWIeUnjv1

name: sfchronicle
text: There are no signs that Airbnb will address challenges specific to high-demand locations like Lake Tahoe, where short-term rentals have become a source of contention and communities are clamping down on them. https://t.co/BVtAG9wXRJ

name: sfchronicle
text: The situation in California is dire, and if the surge gets much worse — as many expect it will after Christmas and New Year’s — then hospitals will face intolerable conditions, public health experts say. https://t.co/xvdeZTHnDd

name: sfchronicle
text: With San Francisco locked down, the holidays may feel more blue than red and green. But even though many indoor activities are suspended, the city itself is a stocking overflowing with treasures waiting to be discovered. https://t.co/atDGXAd4Oy

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: Milpitas police are investigating a shooting at the Great Mall; stores have been asked to shelter-in-place. 

https://t.co/fP6q4APQBP

name: sfchronicle
text:
Sometimes, to catch an arsonist, you have to do the unthinkable.

Let him set more fires. https://t.co/jchkLMtZXv

name: sfchronicle
text:
“Please stay away from the area and we’ll provide additional updates shortly,” Milpitas police said on Twitter.

More than a dozen law enforcement vehicles were parked outside of the Great Mall shortly before 7 p.m.

https://t.co/YOnXAgjKdO

name: sfchronicle
text: The pandemic has also intensified S.F.'s drug overdose epidemic by disrupting city services and forcing many people, who often rely on others to help save them if they overdose, to use alone. https://t.co/32xlA92knv

name: sfchronicle
text: “I’m overwhelmed by the magnificence of your artistry,” Kamala Harris told @tygordonsworld in a phone call after a video of him painting her racked up more than 1.5 million views. “You really have a gift, my goodness, such a gift.” https://t.co/kaoDsNebqt

name: sfchronicle
text:
Dozens of shoppers exit one of the entrances of the Great Mall in Milpitas. They could be seen putting their hands on their heads while shuffling toward the entrance, only dropping them to their sides when passing the threshold. 

Updates: https://t.co/kcPqIYFouk https://t.co/ZgFdAsPCXV

name: sfchronicle
text: Instacart’s value doubled this year to $17.7 billion, and Amazon’s grocery-delivery orders tripled in the three months after shelter-in-place. https://t.co/92aGZ8dlfg

name: sfchronicle
text:
Milpitas police were investigating a shooting at the Great Mall on Saturday evening, prompting a lock-down of the mall’s stores while law-enforcement combed the shopping center.

https://t.co/AfeCEsyqJO

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Warriors’ plans to bring Jeremy Lin onto their G League team fell apart Saturday night, when Golden State was unable to receive his Letter of Clearance from FIBA by the deadline.

https://t.co/fempnjjh96

name: sfchronicle
text:
Muni is slowly restoring service on its train lines. The J-Church returned to the streets on Saturday, and the T-Third is scheduled to resume service in a month.

https://t.co/S8BugziJLd
